Description: Textile fragment of a thick, weft-faced plain weave, woollen cloth; one end of a purple-coloured clavus/shoulder band with plain cream wool on either side; outline decoration in centre of band in undyed linen with roundels and interlace; pearled border with little crescents in red, turquoise and mauve wool; plain weave: warp-undyed wool (S/7), weft-undyed wool (S/46); tapestry on single threads: warp-(S/7), weft-purple wool (S/44); extra threads (S spun Z ply) in light pink,red and blue wool and undyed linen; purple threads are a mix of red and blue fibres; selvedge with looped fringe (cream or purple), selvedge has 6 group warp threads and originally 5 rows of loops, extra weft thread for loops, loops c.4cm long, twisting back on themselves, other edges cut in modern times; from the hem of a tunic
Curator's comments: Unreg 95; fringe similar to 72483 & 72390; previously in grey plan chest in Student's Room
